title: Process Discipline (QA & Versioning)
learning_objectives: Implement Scifeon’s internal QA and version control procedures during proposal development.
Ensure every document is reviewable and traceable.
Understand why discipline in document control builds customer trust.
content:
Process discipline transforms Scifeon’s work from ad hoc to auditable. Every proposal must follow defined QA checkpoints: internal review, cross-check, and version approval. Each stage must be documented in the version history section of the proposal template.

Enterprise clients expect traceability of authorship and approval. Missing version control or inconsistent formatting signals immaturity. Our goal is to show that Scifeon operates under the same standards we enable for our customers—organized, validated, and documented.

exercises.instruction: Simulate a proposal review by marking one draft with reviewer initials, date, and version comment.
Identify three QA criteria that should be checked before submitting a proposal.

quiz.question: What does missing QA documentation signal to a customer?
